query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Quando per dilettanze o ver per doglie, 2 che alcuna virtù nostra comprenda, 3 l’anima bene ad essa si raccoglie,
4 par ch’a nulla potenza più intenda; 5 e questo è contra quello error che crede 6 ch’un’anima sovr’ altra in noi s’accenda.
query.result:
**English:**
1 When, for delight or else for pain, 2 some power of ours apprehends, 3 the soul gathers itself wholly to that,
4 it seems that it gives heed to no other power; 5 and this is against that error which believes 6 that one soul is kindled within us above another.
**Malay:**
1 Ketika, untuk kesenangan atau kesakitan, 2 beberapa kekuatan kita memahami, 3 jiwa benar-benar berkumpul dengannya,
4 tampaknya ia tidak lagi memperhatikan kekuatan lainnya; 5 dan ini bertentangan dengan kesalahan yang percaya 6 bahwa satu jiwa dinyalakan di atas jiwa lainnya dalam diri kita.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 Di ciò ebb’ io esperïenza vera, 14 udendo quello spirto e ammirando; 15 ché ben cinquanta gradi salito era
16 lo sole, e io non m’era accorto, quando 17 venimmo ove quell’ anime ad una 18 gridaro a noi: «Qui è vostro dimando».
query.result:
**English:**
13 Of this I had true experience, 14 hearing that spirit and wondering; 15 for the sun had climbed well fifty degrees, 16 and I had not noticed, when 17 we came to where those souls together 18 cried out to us: "Here is your request."
**Malay:**
13 Tentang hal ini aku mempunyai pengalaman yang nyata, 14 mendengar roh itu dan bertanya-tanya; 15 karena matahari telah naik dengan baik lima puluh derajat, 16 dan aku tidak menyadarinya, ketika 17 kami sampai di tempat di mana jiwa-jiwa itu bersama-sama 18 berseru kepada kami: "Di sinilah permintaanmu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
19 Maggiore aperta molte volte impruna 20 con una forcatella di sue spine 21 l’uom de la villa quando l’uva imbruna,
22 che non era la calla onde salìne 23 lo duca mio, e io appresso, soli, 24 come da noi la schiera si partìne.
query.result:
**English:**
19 Many times a greater hedge impedes 20 with a little fork of its spines 21 the man of the village when the grape darkens,
22 which was not the path where my leader climbed, 23 and I behind him, alone, 24 as the troop departed from us.
**Malay:**
19 Pagar yang lebih besar sering kali menghalangi 20 dengan garpu kecil durinya 21 penduduk desa ketika anggur menjadi gelap,
22 yang bukan jalan setapak tempat pemimpinku memanjat, 23 dan aku di belakangnya, sendirian, 24 saat pasukan itu berpisah dari kami.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
31 Noi salavam per entro ’l sasso rotto, 32 e d’ogne lato ne stringea lo stremo, 33 e piedi e man volea il suol di sotto.
query.result:
**English:**
31 We climbed through the broken rock, 32 and on each side the narrow pass hemmed us in, 33 and the ground beneath demanded hands and feet.
**Malay:**
31 Kami memanjat melalui batu yang pecah, 32 dan di setiap sisi lorong sempit itu mengurung kami, 33 dan tanah di bawah menuntut tangan dan kaki.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 Poi che noi fummo in su l’orlo suppremo 35 de l’alta ripa, a la scoperta piaggia, 36 «Maestro mio», diss’ io, «che via faremo?».
query.result:
**English:**
34 After we were on the highest edge 35 of the high bank, on the open shore, 36 "My Master," I said, "what path shall we take?"
**Malay:**
34 Setelah kami berada di tepi tertinggi 35 dari tebing yang tinggi, di pantai yang terbuka, 36 "Guruku," kataku, "jalan mana yang akan kita ambil?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Ed elli a me: «Nessun tuo passo caggia; 38 pur su al monte dietro a me acquista, 39 fin che n’appaia alcuna scorta saggia».
query.result:
**English:**
37 And he to me: "Let not your step falter; 38 just keep climbing up the mountain behind me, 39 until some wise guide appears."
**Malay:**
37 Dan dia kepadaku: "Jangan biarkan langkahmu goyah; 38 teruslah mendaki gunung di belakangku, 39 hingga muncul pemandu yang bijaksana."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
40 Lo sommo er’ alto che vincea la vista, 41 e la costa superba più assai 42 che da mezzo quadrante a centro lista.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Its summit is so high that it vanquishes the sight, 41 and its proud slope is much steeper 42 than that which a quadrant lists from its center.
**Malay:**
40 Puncaknya sangat tinggi sehingga mengalahkan pandangan, 41 dan lerengnya yang curam jauh lebih curam 42 daripada yang tertera pada seperempat kuadran dari pusatnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 Io era lasso, quando cominciai: 44 «O dolce padre, volgiti, e rimira 45 com’ io rimango sol, se non restai».
query.result:
**English:**
43 I was weary, when I began: 44 "O sweet father, turn and look, 45 how I remain alone, if you do not stay."
**Malay:**
43 Aku lelah, ketika aku mulai: 44 "Wahai ayah yang manis, berpalinglah dan lihatlah, 45 bagaimana aku tetap sendirian, jika kamu tidak tinggal."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 «Figliuol mio», disse, «infin quivi ti tira», 47 additandomi un balzo poco in sùe 48 che da quel lato il poggio tutto gira.
query.result:
**English:**
46 "My son," he said, "thus far you are drawn along," 47 pointing out to me a ledge a little higher up, 48 which goes all around the hill on that side.
**Malay:**
46 "Anakku," katanya, "sejauh ini kamu telah ditarik," 47 menunjukkan kepadaku sebuah langkan sedikit di atas 48 yang mengelilingi bukit di sisi itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 Sì mi spronaron le parole sue, 50 ch’i’ mi sforzai carpando appresso lui, 51 tanto che ’l cinghio sotto i piè mi fue.
query.result:
**English:**
49 His words so spurred me on, 50 that I exerted myself, following close behind him, 51 so much that the belt was beneath my feet.
**Malay:**
49 Kata-katanya begitu memacuku, 50 sehingga aku berusaha keras mengikuti di belakangnya, 51 sedemikian rupa sehingga ikat pinggangku berada di bawah kakiku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 A seder ci ponemmo ivi ambedui 53 vòlti a levante ond’ eravam saliti, 54 che suole a riguardar giovare altrui.
query.result:
**English:**
52 There we both sat down together 53 facing the east, from which we had ascended, 54 which is accustomed to giving joy to others to look at.
**Malay:**
52 Di sana kami berdua duduk bersama 53 menghadap ke timur dari mana kami telah mendaki, 54 yang biasanya memberikan kegembiraan kepada orang lain untuk dilihat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 Li occhi prima drizzai ai bassi liti; 56 poscia li alzai al sole, e ammirava 57 che da sinistra n’eravam feriti.
query.result:
**English:**
55 First I turned my eyes to the low shores; 56 then I raised them to the sun, and saw 57 that we were smitten by it on the left.
**Malay:**
55 Pertama-tama aku mengarahkan mataku ke pantai yang rendah; 56 kemudian aku mengangkatnya ke matahari, dan melihat 57 bahwa kami terluka olehnya di sebelah kiri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Ben s’avvide il poeta ch’ïo stava 59 stupido tutto al carro de la luce, 60 ove tra noi e Aquilone intrava.
query.result:
**English:**
58 The poet realized that I was 59 completely stunned by the chariot of light, 60 which was entering between us and the North Wind.
**Malay:**
58 Penyair itu menyadari bahwa aku 59 benar-benar tercengang oleh kereta cahaya, 60 yang sedang memasuki antara kami dan Angin Utara.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Ond’ elli a me: «Se Castore e Poluce 62 fossero in compagnia di quello specchio 63 che sù e giù del suo lume conduce,
64 tu vedresti il Zodïaco rubecchio 65 ancora a l’Orse più stretto rotare, 66 se non uscisse fuor del cammin vecchio.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Then he said to me: "If Castor and Pollux 62 were in the company of that mirror 63 that leads its light up and down,
64 you would see the red Zodiac 65 still rotating closer to the Bears, 66 if it did not leave the old path.
**Malay:**
61 Kemudian dia berkata kepadaku: "Jika Castor dan Pollux 62 berada di dalam rombongan cermin itu 63 yang menuntun cahayanya ke atas dan ke bawah,
64 kamu akan melihat Zodiak merah 65 masih berputar lebih dekat ke Beruang, 66 jika ia tidak keluar dari jalan lama.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 Come ciò sia, se ’l vuoi poter pensare, 68 dentro raccolto, imagina Sïòn 69 con questo monte in su la terra stare
70 sì, ch’amendue hanno un solo orizzòn 71 e diversi emisperi; onde la strada 72 che mal non seppe carreggiar Fetòn,
73 vedrai come a costui convien che vada 74 da l’un, quando a colui da l’altro fianco, 75 se lo ’ntelletto tuo ben chiaro bada».
query.result:
**English:**
67 How this may be, if you wish to be able to understand it, 68 imagine Sion gathered within itself, 69 with this mountain standing on the earth,
70 so that both have a single horizon 71 and different hemispheres; whence the road 72 that Phaethon did not know how to drive well,
73 you will see how it is necessary for him to go 74 from the one, when the other is on the opposite side, 75 if your intellect pays close attention.
**Malay:**
67 Bagaimana ini mungkin, jika kamu ingin dapat memahaminya, 68 bayangkan Sion terkumpul di dalamnya sendiri, 69 dengan gunung ini berdiri di bumi,
70 sehingga keduanya memiliki satu cakrawala 71 dan belahan bumi yang berbeda; dari situ jalan 72 yang Phaethon tidak tahu cara mengendarainya dengan baik,
73 kamu akan melihat bagaimana ia harus pergi 74 dari yang satu, ketika yang lain berada di sisi yang berlawanan, 75 jika intelekmu memperhatikan dengan seksama.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 «Certo, maestro mio,» diss’ io, «unquanco 77 non vid’ io chiaro sì com’ io discerno 78 là dove mio ingegno parea manco,
79 che ’l mezzo cerchio del moto superno, 80 che si chiama Equatore in alcun’ arte, 81 e che sempre riman tra ’l sole e ’l verno,
82 per la ragion che di’, quinci si parte 83 verso settentrïon, quanto li Ebrei 84 vedevan lui verso la calda parte.
query.result:
**English:**
76 "Certainly, my master," I said, "never 77 did I see so clearly as I discern 78 there where my intellect seemed to fail,
79 that the middle circle of the supernal motion, 80 which is called the Equator in some art, 81 and which always remains between the sun and winter,
82 for the reason that you say, departs from here 83 toward the north, as much as the Hebrews 84 saw it toward the warm region.
**Malay:**
76 "Tentu saja, tuanku," kataku, "belum pernah 77 aku melihat dengan jelas seperti yang aku lihat 78 di sana di mana intelekku tampak gagal,
79 bahwa lingkaran tengah dari gerakan supernal, 80 yang disebut Khatulistiwa dalam beberapa seni, 81 dan yang selalu berada di antara matahari dan musim dingin,
82 karena alasan yang Anda katakan, berangkat dari sini 83 ke arah utara, sebanyak orang-orang Ibrani 84 melihatnya ke arah wilayah yang hangat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Ma se a te piace, volontier saprei 86 quanto avemo ad andar; ché ’l poggio sale 87 più che salir non posson li occhi miei».
query.result:
**English:**
85 But if it pleases you, I would gladly know 86 how much more we have to go; for the hill rises 87 more than my eyes can climb.
**Malay:**
85 Tetapi jika engkau suka, dengan senang hati aku ingin tahu 86 seberapa jauh lagi kita harus pergi; karena bukit itu menanjak 87 lebih tinggi dari yang dapat dipanjat oleh mataku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 Ed elli a me: «Questa montagna è tale, 89 che sempre al cominciar di sotto è grave; 90 e quant’ om più va sù, e men fa male.
query.result:
**English:**
88 And he to me: "This mountain is such, 89 that it is always difficult at the beginning, 90 and the more one goes up, the less it hurts."
**Malay:**
88 Dan dia kepadaku: "Gunung ini sedemikian rupa, 89 sehingga selalu sulit pada awalnya, 90 dan semakin seseorang naik, semakin sedikit rasa sakitnya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 Però, quand’ ella ti parrà soave 92 tanto, che sù andar ti fia leggero 93 com’ a seconda giù andar per nave,
94 allor sarai al fin d’esto sentiero; 95 quivi di riposar l’affanno aspetta.
query.result:
**English:**
91 But when she will seem so sweet to you 92 that it will be easy for you to go up 93 as it is to go down a river in a boat,
94 then you will be at the end of this path; 95 there you can expect to rest from your toil.
**Malay:**
91 Akan tetapi, ketika dia tampak begitu manis bagimu 92 sehingga kamu akan merasa ringan untuk melangkah maju 93 seperti halnya saat perahu mengikuti arus sungai,
94 maka kamu akan sampai di ujung jalan ini; 95 di sana kamu dapat berharap untuk beristirahat dari kerja kerasmu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
96 Più non rispondo, e questo so per vero».
97 E com’ elli ebbe sua parola detta, 98 una voce di presso sonò: «Forse 99 che di sedere in pria avrai distretta!».
query.result:
**English:**
96 I answer no more, and this I know for true."
97 And when he had spoken his word, 98 a voice from nearby sounded: "Perhaps 99 you will first be distressed by sitting down!"
**Malay:**
96 Aku tidak menjawab lagi, dan ini kutahu pasti."
97 Dan ketika ia telah mengucapkan perkataannya, 98 sebuah suara dari dekat terdengar: "Mungkin 99 kamu akan terlebih dahulu menderita karena duduk!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 Al suon di lei ciascun di noi si torse, 101 e vedemmo a mancina un gran petrone, 102 del qual né io né ei prima s’accorse.
query.result:
**English:**
100 At the sound of her, each of us turned, 101 and we saw on the left a great rock, 102 which neither I nor he had noticed before.
**Malay:**
100 Mendengar suaranya, kami semua menoleh, 101 dan kami melihat di sebelah kiri sebuah batu besar, 102 yang sebelumnya tidak kulihat maupun dia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 Là ci traemmo; e ivi eran persone 104 che si stavano a l’ombra dietro al sasso 105 come l’uom per negghienza a star si pone.
query.result:
**English:**
103 There we came to them; and there were people 104 who were standing in the shade behind a rock, 105 as a man places himself to stand out of idleness.
**Malay:**
103 Di sana kami datang kepada mereka; dan di sana ada orang-orang 104 yang berdiri di bawah naungan di balik batu, 105 seperti seorang pria yang karena malasnya berdiri di sana.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 E un di lor, che mi sembiava lasso, 107 sedeva e abbracciava le ginocchia, 108 tenendo ’l viso giù tra esse basso.
query.result:
**English:**
106 And one of them, who seemed weary to me, 107 was sitting and embracing his knees, 108 holding his face down low between them.
**Malay:**
106 Dan salah seorang dari mereka, yang tampak lelah bagiku, 107 duduk dan memeluk lututnya, 108 menundukkan wajahnya di antara lututnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 «O dolce segnor mio», diss’ io, «adocchia 110 colui che mostra sé più negligente 111 che se pigrizia fosse sua serocchia».
query.result:
**English:**
109 "O my sweet lord," I said, "look at 110 the one who shows himself more negligent 111 than if laziness were his sister."
**Malay:**
109 "Wahai tuanku yang manis," kataku, "lihatlah 110 dia yang menunjukkan dirinya lebih lalai 111 daripada jika kemalasan adalah saudara perempuannya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 Allor si volse a noi e puose mente, 113 movendo ’l viso pur su per la coscia, 114 e disse: «Or va tu sù, che se’ valente!».
query.result:
**English:**
112 Then he turned to us and paid attention to us, 113 moving his face still up along his thigh, 114 and said: “Now go up, for you are strong!”.
**Malay:**
112 Kemudian dia berpaling kepada kami dan memperhatikan kami, 113 menggerakkan wajahnya masih ke atas sepanjang pahanya, 114 dan berkata: “Sekarang pergilah ke atas, karena kamu kuat!”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 Conobbi allor chi era, e quella angoscia 116 che m’avacciava un poco ancor la lena, 117 non m’impedì l’andare a lui; e poscia
118 ch’a lui fu’ giunto, alzò la testa a pena, 119 dicendo: «Hai ben veduto come ’l sole 120 da l’omero sinistro il carro mena?».
query.result:
**English:**
115 Then I knew who he was, and that anguish 116 that was still weighing down my breath a little 117 did not prevent me from going to him; and afterwards
118 when I had reached him, he barely lifted his head, 119 saying: "You have seen well how the sun 120 drives his chariot from the left shoulder?".
**Malay:**
115 Kemudian aku tahu siapa dia, dan kesedihan itu 116 yang masih sedikit membebani nafasku, 117 tidak menghalangiku untuk mendatanginya; dan setelahnya
118 ketika aku sampai padanya, dia nyaris tidak mengangkat kepalanya, 119 berkata: "Kamu telah melihat dengan baik bagaimana matahari 120 mengendarai keretanya dari bahu kiri?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 Li atti suoi pigri e le corte parole 122 mosser le labbra mie un poco a riso; 123 poi cominciai: «Belacqua, a me non dole
124 di te omai; ma dimmi: perché assiso 125 quiritto se’? attendi tu iscorta, 126 o pur lo modo usato t’ha’ ripriso?».
query.result:
**English:**
121 His lazy actions and curt words 122 moved my lips a little to laughter; 123 then I began: "Belacqua, I am not sorry
124 for you now; but tell me: why are you sitting 125 here? Are you waiting for an escort, 126 or has your usual way been taken from you?"
**Malay:**
121 Tindakannya yang malas dan kata-katanya yang singkat 122 menggerakkan bibirku sedikit untuk tertawa; 123 kemudian aku mulai: "Belacqua, aku tidak menyesal
124 untukmu sekarang; tetapi katakan padaku: mengapa kamu duduk 125 di sini? Apakah kamu menunggu pengawalan, 126 atau cara yang biasa kamu lakukan telah diambil darimu?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Ed elli: «O frate, andar in sù che porta? 128 ché non mi lascerebbe ire a’ martìri 129 l’angel di Dio che siede in su la porta.
query.result:
**English:**
127 And he: "O brother, what leads upward? 128 For the angel of God who sits at the gate 129 would not let me go to martyrdom."
**Malay:**
127 Dan dia: "Wahai saudara, apa yang menuntun ke atas? 128 Karena malaikat Tuhan yang duduk di pintu gerbang 129 tidak akan membiarkanku pergi ke tempat para martir."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
130 Prima convien che tanto il ciel m’aggiri 131 di fuor da essa, quanto fece in vita, 132 per ch’io ’ndugiai al fine i buon sospiri,
133 se orazïone in prima non m’aita 134 che surga sù di cuor che in grazia viva; 135 l’altra che val, che ’n ciel non è udita?».
query.result:
**English:**
130 First it is necessary that Heaven turn me around 131 outside of it, as much as it did in life, 132 so that I may delay my good sighs until the end,
133 if prayer does not help me first, 134 that rises up to Heaven from a heart that lives in grace; 135 what is the use of the other, that is not heard in Heaven?”.
**Malay:**
130 Pertama, perlu bagi Langit untuk memutarkanku 131 di luarnya, sebanyak yang dilakukannya dalam hidup, 132 sehingga aku menunda desahan baikku sampai akhir,
133 jika doa tidak membantuku terlebih dahulu, 134 yang naik ke Surga dari hati yang hidup dalam kasih karunia; 135 apa gunanya yang lain, yang tidak didengar di Surga?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
136 E già il poeta innanzi mi saliva, 137 e dicea: «Vienne omai; vedi ch’è tocco 138 meridïan dal sole e a la riva
139 cuopre la notte già col piè Morrocco».
query.result:
**English:**
136 And already the poet was climbing ahead of me, 137 and he said: "Come now; see that the sun has touched 138 midday and night is already covering Morocco with its foot 139 at the shore."
**Malay:**
136 Dan penyair itu sudah mendaki di depanku, 137 dan berkata: "Ayo sekarang; lihatlah matahari telah menyentuh 138 tengah hari dan malam sudah menutupi Maroko dengan kakinya 139 di pantai."
